content: what is the method used in this paper?

The paper designs a multimodal foot biometric system that combines different representation and matching algorithms to improve recognition accuracy [Source 4]. It uses hybrid approaches and extends considerations to fingerprint biometrics since ridge structures are present on the foot [Source 4]. One of the methods used is Soleprint, which detects lines and creases using Prewitt kernels and extracts variances of overlapping blocks as a feature vector [Source 1]. Another method is Eigenfeet, derived from Eigenfaces, which relies on the most relevant features for classification [Source 1].
